author: Marcus Aurelius
thought: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.

author: Seneca
thought: We suffer more often in imagination than in reality.

author: David Goggins
thought: Motivation is crap. Motivation comes and goes. When you’re driven, whatever is in front of you will get destroyed.

author: Naval Ravikant
thought: Impatience with actions, patience with results.

author: Miyamoto Musashi
thought: There is nothing outside of yourself that can enable you to get better, stronger, richer, quicker, or smarter. Everything is within.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
thought: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.

author: Jocko Willink
thought: Discipline equals freedom.

author: Epictetus
thought: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.

author: Socrates
thought: The unexamined life is not worth living.

author: Jordan Peterson
thought: Compare yourself to who you were yesterday, not to who someone else is today.

author: Aristotle
thought: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.

author: Sun Tzu
thought: Sweat more during peace: bleed less during war.

author: Theodore Roosevelt
thought: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.

author: Confucius
thought: The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.

author: Lao Tzu
thought: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.

author: Albert Camus
thought: In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer.

author: Viktor Frankl
thought: When we are no longer able to change a situation, we are challenged to change ourselves.

author: James Clear
thought: You do not rise to the level of your goals. You fall to the level of your systems.

author: Bruce Lee
thought: Do not pray for an easy life, pray for the strength to endure a difficult one.

author: Mike Tyson
thought: Everyone has a plan until they get punched in the mouth.

author: Carl Jung
thought: Until you make the unconscious conscious, it will direct your life and you will call it fate.

author: Plato
thought: The first and greatest victory is to conquer yourself.

author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
thought: To go wrong in one's own way is better than to go right in someone else's.

author: Winston Churchill
thought: If you're going through hell, keep going.

author: Leonardo da Vinci
thought: It had long since come to my attention that people of accomplishment rarely sat back and let things happen to them. They went out and happened to things.

author: Seneca
thought: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.

author: Naval Ravikant
thought: A fit body, a calm mind, a house full of love. These things cannot be bought – they must be earned.

author: Marcus Aurelius
thought: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.

author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb
thought: The three most harmful addictions are heroin, carbohydrates, and a monthly salary.

author: Charles Bukowski
thought: Find what you love and let it kill you.

author: Miyamoto Musashi
thought: Do not regret what you have done.

author: Heraclitus
thought: No man ever steps in the same river twice, for it's not the same river and he's not the same man.

author: Ralph Waldo Emerson
thought: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.

author: George Orwell
thought: In a time of deceit telling the truth is a revolutionary act.

author: Paul Graham
thought: Keep your identity small.

author: Richard Feynman
thought: The first principle is that you must not fool yourself and you are the easiest person to fool.

author: Robert Greene
thought: Win through your actions, never through argument.

author: Ernest Hemingway
thought: There is nothing noble in being superior to your fellow man; true nobility is being superior to your former self.

author: Thich Nhat Hanh
thought: Smile, breathe and go slowly.

author: Rumi
thought: The wound is the place where the Light enters you.

author: Oscar Wilde
thought: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.

author: Tim Ferriss
thought: What we fear doing most is usually what we most need to do.

author: Steve Jobs
thought: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life.

author: Kobe Bryant
thought: Everything negative - pressure, challenges - is all an opportunity for me to rise.

author: Epictetus
thought: No man is free who is not master of himself.

author: Abraham Lincoln
thought: Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe.

author: Franklin D. Roosevelt
thought: A smooth sea never made a skilled sailor.

author: Hormozi
thought: Confidence is not 'they will like me'. Confidence is 'I’ll be fine if they don’t'.

author: David Goggins
thought: The most important conversation is the one you have with yourself.

author: Lao Tzu
thought: He who conquers others is strong; He who conquers himself is mighty.

author: Confucius
thought: We have two lives, and the second begins when we realize we only have one.

author: Ayn Rand
thought: The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me.

author: Napoleon Bonaparte
thought: Victory belongs to the most persevering.

author: Swami Vivekananda
thought: Take up one idea. Make that one idea your life - think of it, dream of it, live on it.

author: Mark Twain
thought: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear, not absence of fear.

author: Malcolm X
thought: The future belongs to those who prepare for it today.

author: Henry David Thoreau
thought: It is not enough to be busy. So are the ants. The question is: What are we busy about?

author: Seneca
thought: If a man knows not to which port he sails, no wind is favorable.

author: Naval Ravikant
thought: Play long-term games with long-term people.

author: Marcus Aurelius
thought: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.

author: Ryan Holiday
thought: The obstacle is the way.

author: Friedrich Nietzsche
thought: That which does not kill us makes us stronger.

author: Booker T. Washington
thought: I have learned that success is to be measured not so much by the position that one has reached in life as by the obstacles which he has overcome.

author: Winston Churchill
thought: Success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.

author: Anonymous
thought: Hard times create strong men. Strong men create good times. Good times create weak men. And, weak men create hard times.

author: Elon Musk
thought: If something is important enough, even if the odds are against you, you should still do it.

author: Gautama Buddha
thought: Your worst enemy cannot harm you as much as your own unguarded thoughts.

author: Robert Greene
thought: Always say less than necessary.

author: Pythagoras
thought: Silence is better than unmeaning words.

author: C.S. Lewis
thought: You can't go back and change the beginning, but you can start where you are and change the ending.

author: John Wick (Fictional)
thought: Fortis Fortuna Adiuvat. (Fortune Favors the Bold).

author: Alexander the Great
thought: I am not afraid of an army of lions led by a sheep; I am afraid of an army of sheep led by a lion.

author: Proverb
thought: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.

author: Epictetus
thought: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.

author: Benjamin Franklin
thought: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.

author: Jiddu Krishnamurti
thought: It is no measure of health to be well adjusted to a profoundly sick society.

author: Kevin Hart
thought: Everybody wants to be famous, but nobody wants to put the work in.

author: Plato
thought: Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something.

author: Anonymous
thought: The pain of discipline is far less than the pain of regret.

author: Michelangelo
thought: The greater danger for most of us lies not in setting our aim too high and falling short; but in setting our aim too low, and achieving our mark.

author: Thomas Edison
thought: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.

author: Naval Ravikant
thought: Specific knowledge cannot be taught, but it can be learned.

author: Socrates
thought: Strong minds discuss ideas, average minds discuss events, weak minds discuss people.

author: Marcus Aurelius
thought: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together, but do so with all your heart.

author: Arthur Schopenhauer
thought: Talent hits a target no one else can hit. Genius hits a target no one else can see.

author: Conor McGregor
thought: There's no talent here, this is hard work. This is an obsession.

author: Dalai Lama
thought: Remember that sometimes not getting what you want is a wonderful stroke of luck.

author: Jordan Peterson
thought: Clean your room.

author: H.P. Lovecraft
thought: The oldest and strongest emotion of mankind is fear, and the oldest and strongest kind of fear is fear of the unknown.

author: Diogenes
thought: I am not an Athenian or a Greek, but a citizen of the world.

author: Miyamoto Musashi
thought: Get beyond love and grief: exist for the good of Man.

author: Anonymous
thought: Don't let the noise of others' opinions drown out your own inner voice.

author: George S. Patton
thought: Accept the challenges so that you can feel the exhilaration of victory.

author: James Allen
thought: Men are anxious to improve their circumstances, but are unwilling to improve themselves; they therefore remain bound.

author: Rickson Gracie
thought: If we fight for money, I’ll stop hitting you when you ask me to. If we fight for honor, I’ll stop hitting you when I feel like it.

author: Tupac Shakur
thought: Reality is wrong. Dreams are for real.

author: Albert Einstein
thought: Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds.

author: Japanese Proverb
thought: Fall seven times, stand up eight.

author: Naval Ravikant
thought: If you can't see yourself working with someone for life, don't work with them for a day.

author: Anonymous
thought: Ships are safe in the harbor, but that is not what ships are built for.

author: Marcus Aurelius
thought: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
